title: The Block's Jess and Norm buy Queensland property for just $17,000
text:
They pocketed a whopping $209,000 despite placing last on The Block last year.

And it seems that reality contestants, Jess Eva and her husband Norm Hogan are making the most out of their winnings, having purchased a block of land on Russell Island in Queensland.

According to The Daily Telegraph, the reality star-turned-radio presenters paid just $17, 000 to buy a 545sq m building block.

The Block's Jess and Norm buy $17,000 block of land in Queensland as they prep to build their dream home

Eva told the publication that the couple purchased the land with intentions to start building their dream home next year.

'We bought on Russell Island because we believe it's the best value land in the country,' Eva told the publication.

'The end goal would be to move there in 15 to 20 years,' Jess added.

New project: Jess told the publication that the couple purchased the land with intentions to start building their dream home next year.

The couple currently reside in Tennyson Point, Central Coast with their two children, Matilda, two, and Fred, five.

Speaking on her Triple M breakfast radio show recently, Jess revealed she and her husband temporarily called it quits split, after she 'emasculated him.'

The mother-of-two explained to her co-hosts Lawrence Mooney and Gus Worland how the fight started, saying they had been indulging in a few drinks before the spat.

Growing family: The couple currently reside in Tennyson Point, Central Coast with their two children, Matilda, two, and Fred, five

'We had a group of people around. And about midnight, I said: ''You know what? I need a holiday. I'm desperate for a holiday,'' she said.

Jess, who has been with Norm for nearly ten years, said he yelled back at her: 'No, you're not...You're not going on a holiday, we can't afford it.'

The couple have previously spoken about wanting more children, but have said financial pressure has made them reconsider

During show's finale last year, the couple sold their apartment at auction for $2,859,000, making a tidy profit of $209,000.
description: They pocketed a whopping $209,000 despite placing last on The Block last year.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
